headings.usage: Title, Game Over Screen, Major Alerts

layout.spacing: Generous (p-8 to p-12 for HUD elements)

hud_container.classes: bg-white/70 backdrop-blur-xl border border-white/20 shadow-lg rounded-2xl p-6

buttons.primary: rounded-full bg-black text-white hover:scale-105 transition-transform active:scale-95 px-6 py-3 font-bold tracking-tight
buttons.secondary: rounded-full bg-white border border-gray-200 text-gray-900 hover:bg-gray-50 px-6 py-3 font-medium

complexity_meter.description: A dynamic wobbling circle or fluid shape that distorts as complexity rises. Do not use a simple progress bar.

visual_enhancers.gradients: None. Use solid colors or very subtle mesh gradients for the 'unknown' field only.

accessibility.contrast_check: Ensure decorative 'unknown' elements do not obscure 'known' interactive elements.
accessibility.reduced_motion: Disable canvas turbulence if prefers-reduced-motion is true.

implementation_steps.instruction: Initialize React Three Fiber canvas. Create a 'Field' component using InstancedMesh or Points for the 'Unknown'. Create a 'Drawing' component for user input.
Implement raycasting to allow users to draw lines on the 2D plane within the 3D space. Store these paths as state.
Use a shader or frame loop to deform the 'Unknown' particles away from the 'Known' drawn lines. Calculate distance field.
Track total length/density of 'Knowns'. Update a global complexity score. Increase 'Unknown' aggression (speed/turbulence) as score rises.
Build the HUD using standard React + Tailwind. Overlay it on the Canvas. Connect it to the game state (score, reset, tools).

textures.description: Subtle abstract texture for overlay if needed.

instructions_to_main_agent: Focus on the 'feel' of the drawing. It should feel like cutting through water or ink spreading. The 'Unknown' should feel alive, not static. Use @react-three/fiber for the game view. Keep the UI extremely minimalâ€”let the game breathe. Do NOT use dark mode. The game is strictly Light/Bright.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for UI panels.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Never use AI assistant Emoji characters.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
